--- Comment #2 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Thanks for the report and analysis. I can reproduce the reported issue with the
flickering and I've fixed this in R-devel: the WM_VSCROLL messages from
WM_MOUSEWHEEL are now not posted when the corresponding window is not
scrollable.

text:
*[Bug 18461] flickering when scrolling in R graphics windows*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18461>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|CONFIRMED                   |CLOSED
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED

--- Comment #3 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Without the fix, I can also reproduce the crash when I increase the amount of
scroll messages to be sent for one mouse wheel message. With the fix applied,
the crash does not happen, because no scroll messages are sent, so I am closing
this bug as fixed.

However, the circumstances under which the crash used to happen would deserve a
closer look, especially if users run into it some other way that doesn't have a
simpler fix: how to properly propagate destruction of a graphic device (when
the window is closed) to avoid invalid memory accesses in code that is
attempting to finish the plotting using no longer valid direct pointers into
device description.
